H0.text: Monotremes are the group that includes both the platypus and the echnida.

H1.text: Prosauropod is the classification that the echnida belongs to, just as the platypus belongs to its monotreme group.

H2.text: Gives live birth is what the echnida is, just like the platypus.

H3.text: Dugongs are echnida that are like the platypus.

A4.text: The five extant monotreme species are the platypus and the four species of echidnas.

A5.text: Monotremes are the only mammals still in existence which lay eggs, rather than bearing live young.
